meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Elaine Thompson Josh Magri Amanda Sonmor Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6071.

td.p: Elaine Thompson, an assistant professor of history originally from Clinton, Louisiana
Josh Magri, a manufacturing consultant from Columbia, Maryland
Amanda Sonmor, a virtual assistant originally from Denver, Colorado (whose 1-day cash winnings total $12,300)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'This 19th century woman nee Sklodowska coined the word "radioactivity", of which she got a bit too much')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: This 19th century woman nee Sklodowska coined the word "radioactivity", of which she got a bit too much

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: Hawthorne called him "the homeliest man I ever saw".)
ElaineWho was Abraham Lincoln
$3,001
AmandaWho is [Me crossed out] Lincoln?
$2,401
JoshWho is Thoreau
$6,001
Abraham Lincoln')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'After meeting him, Hawthorne said he had a "sallow, queer, sagacious visage" warmed by "homely human sympathies"')

tr.td: After meeting him, Hawthorne said he had a "sallow, queer, sagacious visage" warmed by "homely human sympathies"
